channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Family who escaped from Covid-19 isolation facility were in NZ to attend funeral
item.description: Four teenagers who fled from a managed isolation facility in Hamilton last night with their mother had been denied permission to attend their father's funeral. Watch the government's latest media conference here.

item.title: One dead after light aircraft crash in South Canterbury
item.description: One person was killed in a microlight crash in the Mackenzie district on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Greens AGM: Sights set on social equality and animal welfare
item.description: Social inequality and the environment will be top of the Green Party's agenda if they enter negotiations with Labour after the next elections, the party says.

item.title: New ventilator 'very simple and cheap to make' - NZ-born designer
item.description: A NZ-born expert in lung damage who has designed a new and cheap emergency ventilator in response to the Covid-19 crisis says the "art" of mechanical ventilation has become incredibly sophisticated.

item.title: Funding boost of $20 million to help tackle meth addiction in the regions
item.description: The government is investing $20 million to reduce the damage methamphetamine use is causing to families and communities in the regions.

item.title: No new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today
item.description: There have been no more new cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, for the third time this week.

item.title: The Pursuit of Wellness: How to raise healthy children
item.description: With so much advice out there, how can modern parents be sure they're doing a good job? Lucy Corry talks to the experts.

item.title: Fallen NZ soldier remembered as new training centres open in Timor-Leste
item.description: Two new training centres have opened in Timor-Leste to help locals gain trade skills, as the country remembers a fallen New Zealand soldier.

item.title: Mass poisoning led to law for new safe water national body
item.description: Four years after contaminated water led to the death of four people and poisoned at least 5000 a new law has been passed to establish a national body to ensure all drinking water is safe.

item.title: Fifth person who escaped from managed isolation in Hamilton detained
item.description: Four of the five people who absconded from a managed isolation facility in Hamilton last night will appear in court today - charged with breaching the Health Act.

item.title: Nine New Zealand cheeses recalled after listeria test
item.description: Talbot Forest Cheese said unconfirmed test results had indicated the presence of the bacteria in one of the products processed at the company's factory in Geraldine.

item.title: Five men arrested over sexual offending involving a minor
item.description: Five men have been arrested in Northland after an investigation into allegations of a sexual nature involving a minor.

item.title: Bad vibes: Rating political scandals by Twitter toxicity
item.description: As chaos swirled, the tweets got darker - but which day was peak bleak?

item.title: Otago University graduate raises $30k for mental health and suicide awareness
item.description: Just a little shy of 3000km and $30,000, Jono Hartland has put in a good effort.

item.title: Five people escape isolation facility in Hamilton
item.description: A 17-year-old man remains missing after he and four others escaped their isolation hotel in Hamilton tonight.

item.title: Police arrest man in Napier Mongrel Mob drug raid
item.description: A Napier man has been arrested after a search of two properties in the city found methamphetamine, cannabis and guns.

item.title: Sealord forfeits $16m vessel over Chatham Rise bottom trawling
item.description: New Zealand's largest fishing company Sealord has been ordered to forfeit a $16 million vessel and fined $24,000 for bottom trawling in a protected area.

item.title: Dedicated nurses for managed isolation 'ideal' - infection control expert
item.description: An infection prevention and control expert says in a perfect world a dedicated team of nurses would be caring for people in Covid-19 managed isolation and quarantine facilities.
